intro: Leontodon collinus, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Leontodon collinus is often found in open meadows and is a characteristic species of high-altitude ecosystems.
